shows.title: Moon Missions / 'Conjuring' House Haunting
shows.first_half: First Half: Prof. Jim Bell will discuss the upcoming anniversary of the historic Apollo 11 Moon landing back in 1969, as well as major highlights from the rest of the Apollo Moon landing missions. He'll also outline the future astronaut exploration of the Moon in NASA’s Artemis program and the plans of other nations.
shows.second_half: Second Half: On July 19th, 2013, the movie The Conjuring was released. Andrea Perron is the eldest daughter of the Perron family whose experiences at their Rhode Island house inspired the film. She'll recall her family’s paranormal encounters, and the help they received from investigators Ed & Lorraine Warren.

shows.title: Influence of the Beatles / Open Lines
shows.first_half: Author Mark Brake joins guest host Rich Berra (email) to discuss how The Beatles rose from Liverpool’s working-class roots to become the most influential band in music history. He’ll dive into the cultural, technological, and artistic forces that shaped their sound-- and how their groundbreaking approach to songwriting, recording, and global fame changed popular music forever. From Beatlemania to studio innovation, Brake unpacks why their impact continues to resonate today. Followed by Open Lines. Give Rich a call and discuss whatever is on your mind!
